array.string: In Level 2.00, Little AI can flip the tiles on its left and on its right.
It can experience a delightful interaction in a specific configuration of the environment.
Notice that one of the commands now can yield three different types of interactions.
This series of levels illustrates the problem of learning the persistence of objects in the world.
It involves using rudimentary spatial memory that may lay the ground for more complex spatial intelligence.
Little AI begins to manipulate a more complex object made of two different parts.
We currently don't have algorithms that can play levels 2.00 to 2.02 automatically. If you wish to contribute to research in developmental AI, you may address this problem.
You may also invent more levels that exemplify the problem of learning to interact with more complex objects.
